original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yang dag par zhugs pa la bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / de la brten nas sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / de la brten nas sgo thams cad nas dkar po'i chos yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yang dag par zhugs pa la bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / de la brten nas sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / de la brten nas sgo thams cad nas dkar po'i chos yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have thus engaged in the correct practice accumulate the accumulations of merit and wisdom, on the basis of which they purify obscurations, on the basis of which they accomplish all positive qualities in every way and on the basis of which they bring sentient beings to full maturity.

analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sogs par 'gyur ba'i chos ni bzhi ste /

original: sgrib pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i chos ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i chos ni bzhi ste /
translated: The dharmas that cause the purification of the obscurations are four:

analyzed: theg pa las rnam par mi g-yo ba dang / rang gis gzhan dag la mi sgrub pa'i rgyu yongs su spong ba nyid dang / log par sgrub pa'i rgyu yongs su spong ba nyid dang / yang dag pa'i sgrub pa yongs su mi rdzogs pa'i rgyu yongs su spong ba nyid do //

analyzed: sgo thams cad nas dkar po'i chos yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi ste /

original: bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i dang / sdug bsngal bzod pa nyid ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i dang / nyan pa dang / sems pas mi ngoms pa nyid ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i dang / sdug bsngal bzod pa nyid ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i dang / nyan pa dang / sems pas mi ngoms pa nyid ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i'o //

analyzed: som nyi dang yid gnyis dang / the tshom las rnam par slong bar byed pa dang / ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba las rnam par slong bar byed pa dang / theg pa dman pa la mos pa las rnam par slong bar byed pa dang /
translated: causing them to be drawn out of doubt, uncertainty, and skepticism, causing them to be drawn out of the lower realms, the unfortunate rebirths, causing them to be drawn out of the aspiration for the lower vehicle,

original: bstan pa la kun nas mnar sems dang / khong khro ba'i sems las rnam par slong bar byed pa pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa la kun nas mnar sems dang / khong khro ba'i sems las rnam par slong bar byed pa pa'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la zhugs pa ji ltar gyur na /

analyzed: chos spyod pa dang / snyoms par spyod pa dang / dge ba spyod pa dang / chos la gnas par gyur na'o //

analyzed: ji ltar na chos spyod pa yin /

original: de la rnam pa ni du yod ce na /

translated: Moreover, it should be understood as fivefold:ğŸ”½compassion for those who harm and sin, because he wishes to establish them in virtue and benefit them;

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as being of eight kinds:ğŸ”½He is impartial in his love for all beings, he is impartial in his non-violence toward all beings, he is impartial in his non-discriminaÂ­tion among beings, he is impartial in his non-expectation of rewards, he is impartial in his non-differentiation of the three vehicles, he is impartial in his non-differentiation of the stages, and he is impartial in his non-differentiation of the transcendences.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the immeasurables, for he practices the immeasurables of love, compassion, joy, and renunciation, without differentiating among beings.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the perfections, for he practices the six perfections of giving, morality, tolerance, effort, meditation, and wisdom, without differentiating among them.

translated: He is impartial in his practice of the means of attracting disciples, for he practices the four means of attracting disciplesâ€”giving, pleasant speech, beneficent conduct, and solidarityâ€”without differentiating among them.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the factors of enlightenment, for he practices the seven factors of enlightenmentâ€”memory, discernment of Dharma, effort, joy, fitness, concentration, and equanimityâ€”without differentiating among them.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the members of the path, for he practices the members of the pathâ€”right view, right intention, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentrationâ€”without differentiating among them.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the liberations, for he practices the eight liberations without differentiating among them.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the bases of mastery, for he practices the eight bases of mastery without differentiating among them.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the bases of totality, for he practices the ten bases of totality without differentiating among them.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the superknowledges, for he practices the six superknowledges without differentiating among them.

original: 'du 'dzi'i gtam spangs te dga' ba'i bzhin du byas nas khur blangs pa nyams su lon par byed pa nyid dang / mnyam par khur ma blangs pa len par byed pa nyid dang / mnyam par sdug bsngal thams cad bzod par byed pa nyid @109a * //

translated: He is impartial in his practice of the concentrations, for he practices the four concentrations without differentiating among them.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the formless states, for he practices the four formless states without differentiating among them.ğŸ”½He is impartial in his practice of the emptiness, the signless, and the wishless, for he practices

original: dang ; mnyam par gdul ba dpag tu med pa'i thabs yongs su tshol ba nyid dang / mnyam par phan tshun tshig yang dag par bzod pa'i tshig dang ldan pa nyid dang / mnyam par dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba nyid do //
analyzed: dang ; mnyam par gdul ba dpag tu med pa'i thabs yongs su tshol ba nyid dang / mnyam par phan tshun tshig yang dag par bzod pa'i tshig dang ldan pa nyid dang / mnyam par dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba nyid do //
translated: and the same in seeking the means to convert the infinite variety of beings to be converted, and the same in being endowed with speech that is mutually acceptable, and the same in dedicating all roots of virtue to enlightenment.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dge ba spyod pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dge ba spyod pa yin /
translated: How is the bodhisattva virtuous?

original: de la rnam pa ni du yod ce na /ğŸ”½nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brten nas /ğŸ”½dge ba kun tu spyod par byed de /
analyzed: de la rnam pa ni du yod ce na / nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brten nas / dge ba kun tu spyod par byed de /
translated: What are the aspects of that virtue?ğŸ”½Virtue is of two kinds: that which is internal to the bodhisattva and that which is external to him.

original: de'i phyir dge ba spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba spyod pa yin no //
translated: The internal is that which perfects the bodhisattva himself, and the external is that which perfects other beings.

original: de ni rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
translated: Virtue is of seven kinds:

original: mi gnas pa'i sbyin pa nyid dang / mi gnas pa'i tshul khrims nyid dang / snying brtse ba'i bzod pa nyid dang / nyi tshe ba ma yin pa'i brtson 'grus nyid dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i gnas kyi bsam gtan nyid dang / lta ba dang bral ba'i shes rab nyid dang /

translated: It is generosity that is not attached, morality that is not attached, patience that is not attached, effort that is not limited, meditation that is the basis for accomplishing the aims of beings, and wisdom that is free from views.

original: yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa nyid do //
translated: It is skill in means for bringing beings to full maturity.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos la gnas pa yin /
translated: How do bodhisattvas abide in the Dharma?

original: de la rnam pa ni du yod ce na /ğŸ”½kun chub pa lhur mi len pa dang / kha ton lhur mi len pa dang / 'chad pa lhur mi len pa dang / rnam par rtog pa lhur mi len par nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas sgom pa la sbyor ba rtsom zhing /
analyzed: de la rnam pa ni du yod ce na / kun chub pa lhur mi len pa dang / kha ton lhur mi len pa dang / 'chad pa lhur mi len pa dang / rnam par rtog pa lhur mi len par nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas sgom pa la sbyor ba rtsom zhing /
translated: What are the aspects of that?

original: yang dag par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub par byed do //
translated: They do not strive for erudition, they do not strive for recitation, they do not strive for teaching, and they do not strive for discursive reasoning, but they do apply themselves to and accomplish the cultivation of inner mental tranquility.

original: de'i phyir chos la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they abide in the Dharma.

original: de ni rnam pa bcu gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcu gnyis su rig par bya ste /

translated: The instruction is to be free of concepts about those who keep or do not keep moral discipline, to receive the instruction respectfully on that basis, and on that basis to be physically secluded.

translated: On that basis, the mind is secluded, and on that basis, one transcends the mental attentions associated with the Listeners' Vehicle and

analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa yid la byed pa nyid dang / de la brten nas rab tu dben pa na sems can brtson pa btang ba rnams dang / mi 'grogs par de las gzhan pa rnams dang 'grogs pa nyid dang /

analyzed: de la brten nas rnam par dag pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pa bsod nams kyi chogs chen po dang @109b mthu bsgom pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong ba nyid dang / 'jig rten pa'i shes pas chog par mi 'dzin par 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa yongs su tshol zhing rnam par sbyor ba nyid dang /
translated: They do not hold mundane wisdom to be sufficient and seek and apply supramundane wisdom.

original: shes pa rnam par dag pa'i nyes pa bzhi spangs te tshogs yongs su sdud pa nyid de /
analyzed: shes pa rnam par dag pa'i nyes pa bzhi spangs te tshogs yongs su sdud pa nyid de /
translated: They gather the accumulations by abandoning the four faults of pure wisdom.

original: gnod pa mi bzod pa'i nyes pa dang / ma nges par ston cing 'doms pa nyes pa dang / ji skad smras pa de bzhin mi byed pa'i nyes pa dang / zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyi nyes pas te /

translated: The four faults are not being able to tolerate harm, the fault of teaching and instructing in an uncertain manner, the fault of not doing what one has said one will do, and the fault of having a mind that is attached to material things.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag dang / snga ma rnam pa brgyad po dag ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag dang / snga ma rnam pa brgyad po dag ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //
translated: These four and the previous eight make twelve.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la dad pa skyed pa'i dpe dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la dad pa skyed pa'i dpe dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the examples that generate faith in bodhisattvas?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is like the earth, because from the first production of the thought of enlightenment,

original: thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma dag tu sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pas gnod pa byed pa dang / lan byed pa thams cad kyi sems yongs su ma gtugs pa'i phyir sa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma dag tu sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pas gnod pa byed pa dang / lan byed pa thams cad kyi sems yongs su ma gtugs pa'i phyir sa lta bu yin no //
translated: he is the basis for the accomplishment of the roots of virtue of all beings, in the beginning, middle, and end, and because he is not exhausted by all the thoughts of injury and retaliation.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar tha mal par gnas pa'i sa la brten nas sems can rnams rang gi skyes bu'i byed pas de la nye bar 'tshe bar byed pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /

translated: However, just as ordinary people, on the basis of the earth, injure it through their own personal actions, the bodhisattva is not like that.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir rab tu dang ba dang / mchog tu dga' bas mngon par rlan par byed pas chu lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir rab tu dang ba dang / mchog tu dga' bas mngon par rlan par byed pas chu lta bu yang yin no //
translated: He is like water, because he is moistened with faith and supreme joy in order to generate the roots of virtue.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar chu'i lo tog yongs su smyin par byed pa dang mi mthun pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar chu'i lo tog yongs su smyin par byed pa dang mi mthun pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like the wind that ripens the harvest of crops.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir kun tu skyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir kun tu skyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la /
translated: It is like a person who, in order to ripen the roots of virtue,

original: kun tu skyo zhing kun tu gdung bar byed pa'i phyir mi lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: kun tu skyo zhing kun tu gdung bar byed pa'i phyir mi lta bu yang yin no //
translated: causes weariness and distress with regard to the phenomena that cause weariness.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar me sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par bsgrubs pa dang mi mthun pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /ğŸ”½dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams kyi rnam par grol ba la reg par bya ba nyid mngon par sgrub pa rnam par sgrub pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i gdams ngag nye bar sgrub pas rlung lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar me sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par bsgrubs pa dang mi mthun pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams kyi rnam par grol ba la reg par bya ba nyid mngon par sgrub pa rnam par sgrub pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i gdams ngag nye bar sgrub pas rlung lta bu yang yin no //
translated: However, it is not like the fire that establishes the buddha-field.ğŸ”½It is like the wind that establishes the attainment of the touch of liberation for those whose roots of virtue are ripe.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar rlung mngon par bsgrubs nas nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar rlung mngon par bsgrubs nas nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like the wind that establishes the attainment of the touch of liberation for those whose roots of virtue are not ripe.

original: rang gi dkar po'i chos mngon par 'phel ba'i phyir zla ba lta bu @110a * //ğŸ”½yang yin no //ğŸ”½de lta mod kyi ji ltar zla ba yar gyi ngo kho na la snang bar byed kyi /
analyzed: rang gi dkar po'i chos mngon par 'phel ba'i phyir zla ba lta bu @110a * // yang yin no // de lta mod kyi ji ltar zla ba yar gyi ngo kho na la snang bar byed kyi /
translated: It is like the moon because it causes the increase of one's own bright qualities.ğŸ”½But it is not like the moon because the moon illuminates only the bright half of the month,

original: mar gyi ngo la ma yin pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mar gyi ngo la ma yin pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: not the dark half.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad la shes pa snang ba'i phyir nyi ma lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad la shes pa snang ba'i phyir nyi ma lta bu yang yin no //
translated: But it is like the sun because the bodhisattva illuminates all the bright and dark qualities by means of the universal characteristics.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar nyi ma gza' sgra gcan gyis 'jigs pas yongs su rgyu ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar nyi ma gza' sgra gcan gyis 'jigs pas yongs su rgyu ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like the sun because the sun moves in fear of the RÄhu demon.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'gro ba rnams su nyon mongs pa'i gza' thams cad kyis mi 'jigs par 'jug pa'i phyir seng ge lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'gro ba rnams su nyon mongs pa'i gza' thams cad kyis mi 'jigs par 'jug pa'i phyir seng ge lta bu yang yin no //
translated: But it is like a lion because the bodhisattva enters the migrations without fear of any of the demons of the afflictions.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar seng ge khal chen pos sgyid lug par 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar seng ge khal chen pos sgyid lug par 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like a great burden that causes a lion to become weary.

original: sdug bsngal gyi khur thams cad khyer ba'i phyir glang po che du la ba lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khur thams cad khyer ba'i phyir glang po che du la ba lta bu yang yin no //
translated: It is like a great elephant, because it carries the burden of all suffering.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar glang po che rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / tshig 'jam pa dang / mi 'jam pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi spyod pa dag gis rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gis gos par 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar glang po che rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / tshig 'jam pa dang / mi 'jam pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi spyod pa dag gis rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gis gos par 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like an elephant that is defiled by attachment and aversion to pleasant and unpleasant things, such as gain and loss, pleasant and unpleasant speech.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gis mi gos pa'i phyir padma lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gis mi gos pa'i phyir padma lta bu yang yin no //
translated: It is like a lotus, because the bodhisattva is not defiled by attachment and aversion to any worldly things.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar padma sdong bu las bcad na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar padma sdong bu las bcad na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like a lotus that is cut off from its stalk and becomes a thing that does not grow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyon mongs pa bcom yang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs skyed pas yang 'khor bar skye ba'i phyir rtsa ba ma nyams pa'i shin ljon pa lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyon mongs pa bcom yang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs skyed pas yang 'khor bar skye ba'i phyir rtsa ba ma nyams pa'i shin ljon pa lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is also like a great tree whose roots are not destroyed, because he generates the power of the roots of virtue even though he has destroyed the afflictions and is reborn in cyclic existence.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar shin ljon pa tha mar rtsa ba rab tu 'jig par 'gyur ba lta de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar shin ljon pa tha mar rtsa ba rab tu 'jig par 'gyur ba lta de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like the great tree which is finally destroyed at the roots.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub chen por dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir chu'i rgyun rgya mtshor bab pa lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub chen por dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir chu'i rgyun rgya mtshor bab pa lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is also like a river flowing into the ocean, because he dedicates the roots of virtue to nirvana and great enlightenment.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar chu'i rgyun rgya mchor bab na rgya mtsho nyid du 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar chu'i rgyun rgya mchor bab na rgya mtsho nyid du 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like a river flowing into the ocean which becomes the ocean itself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang byang chub chen po la brten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis rnam par rtse ba'i phyir ri rab la gnas pa'i lha lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang byang chub chen po la brten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis rnam par rtse ba'i phyir ri rab la gnas pa'i lha lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is also like a god who lives on Mt. Sumeru, because he plays with the roots of virtue that are based on nirvana and great enlightenment.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar ri rab la gnas pa'i lha @110b rnams rang gi bya ba la bag med par dga' ba mang ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar ri rab la gnas pa'i lha @110b rnams rang gi bya ba la bag med par dga' ba mang ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not the case that he is like a god who lives on Mt. Sumeru, who is often heedless and delights in his own activities.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa dang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir blon pos yongs su zin pa'i rgyal po lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa dang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir blon pos yongs su zin pa'i rgyal po lta bu yang yin no //
translated: He is also like a king who is supported by his ministers, because he accomplishes the deeds of a buddha through his possession of means and insight.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar blon pos yongs su zin pa'i rgyal po bdag nyid kyi don kho na'i phyir skye dgu skyong bar byed pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar blon pos yongs su zin pa'i rgyal po bdag nyid kyi don kho na'i phyir skye dgu skyong bar byed pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not the case that he is like a king who is supported by his ministers, who protects living beings only for his own benefit.

original: bdag nyid kyi don la mi lta bar skye dgu skyong bar byed pa'i phyir sprin chen po lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi don la mi lta bar skye dgu skyong bar byed pa'i phyir sprin chen po lta bu yang yin no //
translated: He is also like a great cloud, because he protects all beings without regard for his own welfare.

original: de lta mod kyi sprin chen po lo tog bsgrub pa la gtan du ba ma yin par ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sprin chen po lo tog bsgrub pa la gtan du ba ma yin par ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But a great cloud is not permanent in producing crops, but he is not like that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gtan du byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos skyed pa'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gtan du byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos skyed pa'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is also like a universal monarch, because he is permanent in producing the factors of enlightenment.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba skyes bu chen po dag dang zla med pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba skyes bu chen po dag dang zla med pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But a universal monarch is not without a rival among great men, but he is not like that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par grol ba thun mong du gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir nor bu rin po che lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par grol ba thun mong du gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir nor bu rin po che lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is also like a precious jewel, because he produces roots of virtue that are shared in by those who are liberated.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar nor bu rin po che k'ashar pa na dang shin tu mi mnyam pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar nor bu rin po che k'ashar pa na dang shin tu mi mnyam pa ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like that, just as a precious jewel is not like a kashmari fruit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings su zhugs pas bya ba mnyam zhing bde ba'i longs spyod mnyam pa'i phyir 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs pa lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings su zhugs pas bya ba mnyam zhing bde ba'i longs spyod mnyam pa'i phyir 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs pa lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like one who has entered the pleasure grove, because he has entered the uncontaminated realm, his activities are equal, and he enjoys equal happiness.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs pa'i lha rnams nyon mongs pa rnam par spel nas phyi ma la log par ltung bar 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar 'dres pa'i tshal du zhugs pa'i lha rnams nyon mongs pa rnam par spel nas phyi ma la log par ltung bar 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like that, just as the gods who have entered the pleasure grove increase their afflictions and later fall into error.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyon mongs pa bcom pas log par mi ltung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i dug bcom pa lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyon mongs pa bcom pas log par mi ltung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i dug bcom pa lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like one who has destroyed the poison of the afflictions, because he has conquered the afflictions and does not fall into error.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar dgu bcom pa gnod pa mi byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar dgu bcom pa gnod pa mi byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: However, it is not like that, just as one who has destroyed the poison is only prevented from being harmed.

original: gang la yang yon tan du ma 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la yang yon tan du ma 'gyur ba ltar de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not so for the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi nyon mongs pas sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa grong khyer chen po'i ljan ljin lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi nyon mongs pas sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa grong khyer chen po'i ljan ljin lta bu yang yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is also like the filth of a great city, because of the afflictions, in order to benefit all sentient beings.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan byi dpe 'jig rten na grags pa'i dngos po de lta bu dang / de dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas yon @111a * //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan byi dpe 'jig rten na grags pa'i dngos po de lta bu dang / de dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas yon @111a * //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is endowed with qualities that are not illustrated by worldly examples, and with qualities that are superior to those.

original: tan dpe med pa yin no //
analyzed: tan dpe med pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with qualities that are not illustrated by examples.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni yon tan dpe med pa dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni yon tan dpe med pa dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is to be known as endowed with qualities that are not illustrated by examples.

original: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la rnam par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la rnam par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas training in the practice of the perfections?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos la gnas pa nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul bshad pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos la gnas pa nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul bshad pa /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the Dharma is one who has gone beyond the discourses of the ÅšrÄvakayÄna that teach the mode of the conventional truth,

original: drang ba'i don bstan par bya ba ma yin pa las shin tu 'das nas /
analyzed: drang ba'i don bstan par bya ba ma yin pa las shin tu 'das nas /
translated: which are not to be taught as the definitive meaning.

original: de la lhag par bya ba byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba byas pa /
analyzed: de la lhag par bya ba byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba byas pa /
translated: He has done what needed to be done and planted the roots of virtue

original: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /
translated: in the profound discourses of the MahÄyÄna that are endowed with emptiness,

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul bshad pa /ğŸ”½nges pa'i don bstan par bya ba la brtson par byed pa na tshul bzhin la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul bshad pa / nges pa'i don bstan par bya ba la brtson par byed pa na tshul bzhin la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
translated: which teach the mode of the conventional and ultimate truths,ğŸ”½and which are to be taught as the definitive meaning.

original: tshul bzhin la brtson pa dang dbu ma'i lam du zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin la brtson pa dang dbu ma'i lam du zhugs pa yin te /
translated: He is one who is diligent in that. He is called â€œone who is diligent in the proper wayâ€ and â€œone who has entered the middle path.â€

original: 'di ltar chos de ni dbu ma'i lam rnam pa bcu gsum smos par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de ni dbu ma'i lam rnam pa bcu gsum smos par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that Dharma is one that is to be described as the middle path in thirteen ways.

original: gang zag stong pa nyid smos par byed pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos stong pa nyid dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang / chos mngon par rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: gang zag stong pa nyid smos par byed pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos stong pa nyid dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang / chos mngon par rtogs pa dang /
translated: the emptiness of the person, the selflessness of the person, the emptiness of phenomena, the selflessness of phenomena, the extreme of superimposition, the extreme of denial, the realization of the truth,

original: de nyid byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba nyid dang / da ltar zhugs pa'i sems nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal dag gis yongs su ma gtugs pa nyid dang / bdag med pa gnyis la mos pa'i khyad par dang / bdag med pa snga ma shos phyi ma'i rgyu nyid yin pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba nyid dang / da ltar zhugs pa'i sems nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal dag gis yongs su ma gtugs pa nyid dang / bdag med pa gnyis la mos pa'i khyad par dang / bdag med pa snga ma shos phyi ma'i rgyu nyid yin pa dang /
translated: the dedication of that very [realization] to great enlightenment, the non-exhaustion of the present mind by afflictions and suffering, the distinction of interest in the two selflessnesses, the former selflessness being the cause of the latter,

original: mthar thug pa'i stong pa nyid dang / de nyid kye mthu smos par byed do //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i stong pa nyid dang / de nyid kye mthu smos par byed do //
translated: and the ultimate emptiness.

original: ji ltar gang zag stong pa nyid smos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag stong pa nyid smos par byed ce na /
translated: How is the emptiness of the person stated?

original: rnam pa gcig gis mi dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa las te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis mi dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa las te /
translated: From the teaching of non-apprehension in one aspect.

original: de la mi dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, this is non-apprehension:

original: dngos po gsum po sems can gyi dngos po dang / de'i sna tshogs kyi dngos po dang / de'i longs spyod kyi dngos po la byis pa rnams kyis kun tu brtags pa'i bdag nang dang phyi rol dang gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gsum po sems can gyi dngos po dang / de'i sna tshogs kyi dngos po dang / de'i longs spyod kyi dngos po la byis pa rnams kyis kun tu brtags pa'i bdag nang dang phyi rol dang gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The three things are the thing of sentient beings, the thing of their variety, and the thing of their enjoyment. The self imagined by the childish is not perceived either as internal, or as external, or as nondual.

original: ji ltar gang zag la bdag med pa smos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag la bdag med pa smos par byed ce na /
translated: How does one indicate the selflessness of the person?

original: rnam pa gcig kho nas dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa las te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig kho nas dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa las te /
translated: From the indication of the perception of just one aspect.

original: de la dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The perception there is as follows:

original: dngos @111b po gsum po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de nyid la rtag pa nyid mi dmigs pas byis pas kun brtags pa'i bdag dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos @111b po gsum po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de nyid la rtag pa nyid mi dmigs pas byis pas kun brtags pa'i bdag dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The self imagined by the childish is perceived as having a different characteristic from the very dependent origination of the three things, because of the nonperception of permanence.

original: ji ltar chos stong pa nyid smos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos stong pa nyid smos par byed ce na /
translated: How does one indicate the emptiness of the dharmas?

original: rnam pa gcig kho nas mi dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa las te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig kho nas mi dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa las te /
translated: From the indication of the nonperception of just one aspect.

original: de la mi dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The nonperception there is as follows:

original: dngos po gsum po mi rtag pas bsdus pa de nyid la byis pas kun brtags pa tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid nang dang phyi rol dang gnyi ga ma gtogs par mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gsum po mi rtag pas bsdus pa de nyid la byis pas kun brtags pa tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid nang dang phyi rol dang gnyi ga ma gtogs par mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The imagined nature that is derived from verbalization is not perceived as separate from those three things that are included in the impermanent.

original: ji ltar chos bdag med pa smos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos bdag med pa smos par byed ce na /
translated: How is the selflessness of dharmas mentioned?

original: rnam pa gcig kho nas dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa las te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig kho nas dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa las te /
translated: It is taught by means of just one aspect, the complete teaching of the object.

original: de la dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: dngos po de nyid la rtag par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / mi rtag par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa la brten nas bdag tu 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / mi rtag par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa la brten nas bdag med par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / bdag med par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa @112a * //
translated: Exaggeration through apprehending permanence in that very thing, exaggeration through apprehending impermanence, exaggeration through apprehending a self based on apprehending permanence, and exaggeration through apprehending selflessness based on apprehending impermanence.

original: la brten nas yang dag pa'i sems su 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa la brten nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems su 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / de yang sems med pa dang tshol ba pa'o //
analyzed: la brten nas yang dag pa'i sems su 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa la brten nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems su 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / de yang sems med pa dang tshol ba pa'o //
translated: Exaggeration through apprehending a real mind based on apprehending selflessness, exaggeration through apprehending an unreal mind based on apprehending a self, and the searcher and the object searched for.

original: tshol ba pa yang des kun brtags pa'i gnas dang / des kun brtags pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: tshol ba pa yang des kun brtags pa'i gnas dang / des kun brtags pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: The searcher is the imagined object, that which is imagined, and that which is concomitant with it.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams la nyes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams la nyes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: There are five faults in relation to all the phenomena of the afflictions that are not in accord with enlightenment.

original: phyin ci log gi nyes pa dang / spros pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i kun nas slong ba'i nyes pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi nyes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi nyes pa dang / spros pa'i nyes pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i kun nas slong ba'i nyes pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi nyes pa dang ngo //
translated: The fault of error, the fault of elaboration, the fault of motivating negative action, the fault of negative propensities and the fault of impermanence.

original: de'i gnyen po rnam par byang ba dag la yang dag pa'i sems su 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po rnam par byang ba dag la yang dag pa'i sems su 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa la brten nas /
translated: In relation to the antidotes to those, there are five faults in relation to the pure side.

original: dge ba la sogs par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa nas rnam par byang ba'i bar du 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems su 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa la brten nas /ğŸ”½mi dge ba la sogs par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa nas /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa nas rnam par byang ba'i bar du 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems su 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa la brten nas / mi dge ba la sogs par 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa nas /
translated: The fault of superimposition in apprehending virtue and so on, the fault of superimposition in apprehending the pure side, the fault of superimposition in apprehending the correct mind,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bar du 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bar du 'dzin pas sgro 'dogs pa ste /
translated: the fault of superimposition in apprehending nonvirtue and so on and the fault of superimposition in apprehending the afflicted side.

original: de dag ni bye brag tu sgro 'dogs pa brgyad yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni bye brag tu sgro 'dogs pa brgyad yin te /
translated: These are the eight specific superimpositions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni sgro 'dogs pa de dag la mngon par zhen par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni sgro 'dogs pa de dag la mngon par zhen par yang mi byed la /
translated: The bodhisattva does not adhere to these superimpositions,

original: gzhan dag la yang dag par 'dzin du yang mi 'jug bsngags pa rjod par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang dag par 'dzin du yang mi 'jug bsngags pa rjod par yang mi byed do //
translated: does not cause others to adhere to them, and does not praise them.

original: de la ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa ni bye brag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i gnas gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa ni bye brag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i gnas gang yin pa ste /
translated: Among these, the superimposition of an intrinsic nature is the basis of the specific superimpositions.

original: dngos po de nyid la byis pas kun brtags pa tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa yod do zhes sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po de nyid la byis pas kun brtags pa tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa yod do zhes sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: It is the superimposition that the entity itself exists as the intrinsic nature that is imagined by the childish and arises from convention.

original: ji ltar skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' smos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' smos par byed ce na /
translated: How does he avoid the extreme of denial?

original: rnam pa gcig gas yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa yongs su bstan pa las te de la yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gas yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa yongs su bstan pa las te de la yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: He demonstrates the denial of existent entities through one aspect, and in that context, the denial of existent entities is as follows.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: log par chos bdag med pa la mos pa rnam pa thams cad du chos kyi mtshan nyid du thams cad med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: log par chos bdag med pa la mos pa rnam pa thams cad du chos kyi mtshan nyid du thams cad med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: It is the adherence to the non-existence of all the characteristics of the Dharma in every way, in the non-existence of the self in dharmas.

original: ji ltar chos mngon par rtogs pa smos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos mngon par rtogs pa smos par byed ce na /
translated: How does one speak of the realization of the Dharma?

original: rnam pa @112b gsum gyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa @112b gsum gyis te /
translated: In three ways:

original: dngos po de nyid dang / bzhi pa skye ba'i dngos po mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su rnam par gnas pa la ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa dang bye brag mi dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po de nyid dang / bzhi pa skye ba'i dngos po mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su rnam par gnas pa la ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa dang bye brag mi dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa dang /
translated: by the teaching of the non-apprehension of the own-being of the thing itself, of the thing that is the basis of the fourth, and of the thing that is the origin, which is the adverse element and counteragent, and by the teaching of the non-apprehension of the distinction between the compounded and the uncompounded.

original: de goms par byas pas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pa yongs su bstan pas so //
analyzed: de goms par byas pas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pa yongs su bstan pas so //
translated: And by the teaching of the full understanding of the knowledge of reality as it is through the cultivation of that.

original: de la ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Herein, the non-apprehension of the own-being is as follows:

original: byis pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byis pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-apprehension of the own-being imagined by the naive.

original: de la bye brag mi dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bye brag mi dmigs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Herein, the non-apprehension of the distinction is as follows:

original: ngo bo nyid de nyid la skye ba dang 'gag pa yang dag par 'grub pa gnyis su med pas mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de nyid la skye ba dang 'gag pa yang dag par 'grub pa gnyis su med pas mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-apprehension of the non-duality of the establishment of origination and cessation in that very reality.

original: de la shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The correct understanding of that is as follows:

original: de'i ngo bo nyid dang de'i mtshan ma yid la mi byed cing yang dag par mi snang ba'i sbyor bas so so rang rig pa dang mthun pa'i shes pa rab tu rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid dang de'i mtshan ma yid la mi byed cing yang dag par mi snang ba'i sbyor bas so so rang rig pa dang mthun pa'i shes pa rab tu rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the understanding of the knowledge that is in accordance with the individual's intuitive wisdom, through the application of not attending to its reality and not manifesting its sign.

original: ji ltar chos mngon par rtogs pa byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba smos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos mngon par rtogs pa byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba smos par byed ce na /
translated: How does one dedicate the realization of the Dharma to great enlightenment?

original: rnam pa gcig gis so sor brtags te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis so sor brtags te /
translated: By means of one aspect, through the attainment of the antidote.

original: gnyen po thob pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi spong ba las te /
analyzed: gnyen po thob pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi spong ba las te /
translated: One does not abandon the counteragent by means of the attainment of the antidote.

original: de la gnyen po dang mi mthun pa ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: de la gnyen po dang mi mthun pa ni 'di yin te ;
translated: Herein, the antidote and the counteragent are as follows:

original: stong pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Emptiness is the antidote to the defilements.

original: smon pa med pa ni srid par smon pa'i'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni srid par smon pa'i'o //
translated: The wishless is the antidote to the wish for existence.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma rnams kyi ste /
translated: The signless is the antidote to the signs.

original: de dag thams cad kyang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All of these are called â€œnon-production.â€

original: de yang yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pa'i las gnyen po dang / skye ba'i rgyun dang ; skad cig skye ba'i rgyun gyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de yang yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pa'i las gnyen po dang / skye ba'i rgyun dang ; skad cig skye ba'i rgyun gyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the antidote to the karma that produces the next existence, and it is the antidote to the continuity of birth and to the continuity of momentary birth.

original: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'du byed thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'du byed thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The cessation of nirvana is called the â€œnon-entityness of all conditioned phenomena.â€

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'khor ba'i rgyun yin no //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'khor ba'i rgyun yin no //
translated: The continuity of samsara is its counteragent.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnyen po des so sor brtags te mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi spongs pa gang yin pa de ni sems can la snying brtse ba las brten te byang chub chen po 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnyen po des so sor brtags te mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi spongs pa gang yin pa de ni sems can la snying brtse ba las brten te byang chub chen po 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva, through this antidote, does not abandon the counteragent by means of critical discernment. This is based on compassion for sentient beings and the desire for great enlightenment.

original: ji ltar de ltar zhugs pa'i sems nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal dag gis yongs su ma gtugs pa nyid smos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ltar zhugs pa'i sems nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal dag gis yongs su ma gtugs pa nyid smos par byed ce na /
translated: How does he, who has thus entered, avoid being overwhelmed by the mental afflictions and suffering?

original: rnam pa gcig gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs @113a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs @113a * //
translated: One aspect is the antidote to the opposing factors.ğŸ”½

original: ma spangs pa'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pa las te /
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pa las te /
translated: from the correct understanding of things as they really are, without having abandoned the counteragents by means of a single mode.

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: And the correct understanding of things as they really are is as follows:

original: chos la bdag med pa'i sbyor bas chos de dag nyid la rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sdug bsngal med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i sbyor bas chos de dag nyid la rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sdug bsngal med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'o //
translated: by the application to the selflessness of dharmas, one sees those very dharmas as devoid of intrinsic defilement and devoid of suffering.

original: ji ltar bye brag smos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag smos par byed ce na /
translated: How does one make a detailed analysis?

original: rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In four ways:

original: lta ba'i bye brag yongs su bstan pa dang / de nyid khyad ches dman pa'i bye brag yongs su bstan pa dang / spong ba la rnam par 'khrul pa'i bye brag yongs su bstan pa dang ; sems rnam pa 'khrul pa'i bye brag yongs su bstan pa las so //
analyzed: lta ba'i bye brag yongs su bstan pa dang / de nyid khyad ches dman pa'i bye brag yongs su bstan pa dang / spong ba la rnam par 'khrul pa'i bye brag yongs su bstan pa dang ; sems rnam pa 'khrul pa'i bye brag yongs su bstan pa las so //
translated: from the detailed explanation of the differences in views, the detailed explanation of the differences in the inferiority of those very views, the detailed explanation of the differences in error in abandoning, and the detailed explanation of the differences in error in mind.

original: de lta ba'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de lta ba'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The differences in views are as follows:

original: gang zag la bdag med pa la gnas pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la phyi mar bdag nyid chad par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du 'gyur ba dang / gzung ba yongs su brtags pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin pa gtan du tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yongs su ma brtags pa'i phyir shes bya shin tu ma rtogs pas chos kyi bdag nyid la mngon par zhen pa des nyon mongs pa spong ba la sogs
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa la gnas pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la phyi mar bdag nyid chad par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du 'gyur ba dang / gzung ba yongs su brtags pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin pa gtan du tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yongs su ma brtags pa'i phyir shes bya shin tu ma rtogs pas chos kyi bdag nyid la mngon par zhen pa des nyon mongs pa spong ba la sogs
translated: Those who abide in the selflessness of persons are conceited about their future self annihilation in nirvana, and because they thoroughly investigate the imputed object, they are not thoroughly investigating the emptiness that is included in the absence of the entityness of the origin of the conventional, the absence of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: pa spong ba yongs su tshol bar byed kyi /
analyzed: pa spong ba yongs su tshol bar byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, because they do not comprehend objects of knowledge, they cling to the identity of phenomena and thus seek to abandon afflictions and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Bodhisattvas are not like that.

original: de la de nyid khyad ches dman pa'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la de nyid khyad ches dman pa'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference between them is that the latter is even more inferior.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa la gnas pa ni rgyu gnyis po sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / rim gyis 'dzin pa gnyis kyis nyams pas sdug bsngal las rnam par ma thar pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo bdag tu lta ba dang ldan pa bas kyang ches dman pa bas dman pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa la gnas pa ni rgyu gnyis po sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / rim gyis 'dzin pa gnyis kyis nyams pas sdug bsngal las rnam par ma thar pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo bdag tu lta ba dang ldan pa bas kyang ches dman pa bas dman pa yin gyi /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin pa'o //

original: de la sems rnam par 'khrul pa'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa la gnas pa de ltar spong ba la rnam par @113b 'khrul pa ni rang gi kun tu rtog pa las byung ba'i yul rnams la 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs pas phyin ci log tu 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin pa'o //

translated: Even though the sravaka has reached the ultimate goal, he is not worthy of being worshipped and praised by gods and men, as is the bodhisattva who has entered the application of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: nyan thos ni nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar byed pa ye shes kyi sman yongs su grub pa yin yang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos ni nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar byed pa ye shes kyi sman yongs su grub pa yin yang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The sravaka is the perfected medicine of knowledge which cures the disease of the defilements, but he does not cure the disease of the defilements of all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: But the bodhisattva, because he is engaged in the welfare of others, is the opposite of that.

original: nyan thos ni mthar thug par gyur pa yin yang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa zad pa sems can rnams la ye shes kyi snang ba byed pa'i phyir lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas kyi 'os nyid du gyur pa de lta buğŸ”½ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos ni mthar thug par gyur pa yin yang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa zad pa sems can rnams la ye shes kyi snang ba byed pa'i phyir lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas kyi 'os nyid du gyur pa de lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: the world with their wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni yin no //
translated: But the bodhisattvas are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dus rtag tu nyan thos pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dus rtag tu nyan thos pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin la /
translated: The tathagatas are always superior to the sravakas,ğŸ”½and the bodhisattvas are superior to them.

original: de dag pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ches shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ches shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
translated: They are superior for two reasons:ğŸ”½because they are the cause of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, and

original: de dag las de dag yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de dag ni rgyu gnyis na ches shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag las de dag yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de dag ni rgyu gnyis na ches shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: because they are the cause of the tathagatas.

original: 'di ltar de dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they have brought beings to maturity and have brought the qualities of the Buddha to maturity.

original: de las byang chub kyi 'bras bu brnyes pa dang / ji ltar na yongs su smin par byas pa'i sems can rnams rnam par grol bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de las byang chub kyi 'bras bu brnyes pa dang / ji ltar na yongs su smin par byas pa'i sems can rnams rnam par grol bar mdzad de /
translated: How do they liberate beings who have been brought to maturity?

original: 'di lta ste dper na sgrub pa po dang g-yos mkhan la ngo mtshar gyi blo 'byung ba ltar /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na sgrub pa po dang g-yos mkhan la ngo mtshar gyi blo 'byung ba ltar /
translated: Just as a magician or a conjurer, having conjured up an illusion, would cause it to disappear,

original: za ba po la de lta ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: za ba po la de lta ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: so the Buddhas, having brought beings to maturity, liberate them.

original: nyan thos ni gcig tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi rgyu yang dag @115b par blangs te gnas shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen du mas yongs su gzung yang /
analyzed: nyan thos ni gcig tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi rgyu yang dag @115b par blangs te gnas shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen du mas yongs su gzung yang /
translated: The Sravakas, having taken up the cause of the pure Dharma, remain in it, and are sustained by many spiritual benefactors,

original: byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: but they do not realize the result of great enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de las bzlog pas kyang 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de las bzlog pas kyang 'grub par byed do //
translated: The Bodhisattvas, on the other hand, do realize it, because they are the opposite of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la brten nas ni nyan thos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la brten nas ni nyan thos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: But the Å›rÄvakas come into being in dependence on the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos la brten nas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos la brten nas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: But the disciples do not appear in dependence on the bodhisattvas.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa dag gis gzhan gyi don bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa dag gis gzhan gyi don bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the performance of benefit for others by means of mundane and supramundane knowledge?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' phyogs thams cad du khams 'pho ba yang rung /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' phyogs thams cad du khams 'pho ba yang rung /
translated: Here the bodhisattva, in all directions, in all realms,

original: yul gzhan du 'pho yang rung /
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'pho yang rung /
translated: in all migrations, in all destinies,

original: skye ba gzhan du 'pho yang rung /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du 'pho yang rung /
translated: in all states of existence, in all forms of birth,

original: gzhan gyis gsol ba btab kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsol ba btab kyang rung ste /
translated: and in all social classes,

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'byung po'i gdon gyis brlams pa'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'byung po'i gdon gyis brlams pa'i sems can rnams la /
translated: for the sake of all sentient beings who are afflicted by the demons of the afflictions,

original: bslab pa gsum gyi lam rnam par dag pa nye bar ston pas gso bar byed pa na sman pa bla na med pa yin no//
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyi lam rnam par dag pa nye bar ston pas gso bar byed pa na sman pa bla na med pa yin no//
translated: is the unsurpassed physician, because he teaches the path of the three trainings as a cure for them.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is mundane knowledge?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rags pa sel ba'i gnyen po dang / 'bring rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rags pa sel ba'i gnyen po dang / 'bring rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The antidote that eliminates gross defilement and the antidote that suppresses middling defilement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rags pa gang zhe na /ğŸ”½khyim pa rnams kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug spyad pa nyid dang rab tu byung ba rnams kyi lta ba la brten pa nyid dang / de'i gnas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin la byed pa la brten pa nyid dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rags pa gang zhe na / khyim pa rnams kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug spyad pa nyid dang rab tu byung ba rnams kyi lta ba la brten pa nyid dang / de'i gnas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin la byed pa la brten pa nyid dang /
translated: What is gross defilement?

original: yang srid par smon pa la brten pa nyid dang / phyin ci log bzhi po bsdus pa dang / re re dag gis thar pa ma yin pa la thar par mngon par zhen pa la brten pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid par smon pa la brten pa nyid dang / phyin ci log bzhi po bsdus pa dang / re re dag gis thar pa ma yin pa la thar par mngon par zhen pa la brten pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the practice of desire, hatred and delusion among householders, the practice of views among those who have gone forth into the homeless state, the practice of the four errors, the practice of the four inversions, the practice of the four bonds, the practice of the four floods, the practice of the four bonds of wrongdoing, the practice of the four ties, the practice of the five hindrances, the practice of the five unwholesome roots, the practice of the five wrong courses of action, the practice of the six roots of sense desire, the practice of the seven latent tendencies, the practice of the eight worldly factors, the practice of the nine causes of irritation, the practice of the ten wrong courses of action.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bring gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bring gang zhe na /
translated: What is middling defilement?

original: rang rang gi gnyen po la brten pas kun nas nyon mongs pa rags pa bstsal ba'i yul la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa'i gnas nyid gang yin pa'o /
analyzed: rang rang gi gnyen po la brten pas kun nas nyon mongs pa rags pa bstsal ba'i yul la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa'i gnas nyid gang yin pa'o /
translated: It is the object of the elimination of gross afflictions by means of their respective antidotes, and it is the state of being completely bound by attachment, hostility, and ignorance.

original: dmigs pa la yang dag par gtang pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyis brtson par byed pa na /
analyzed: dmigs pa la yang dag par gtang pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyis brtson par byed pa na /
translated: By means of correct attention to the object, he strives with the factors of enlightenment in order to place in equipoise the mind that is not in equipoise.

original: de rnam par gnon par byed cing /
analyzed: de rnam par gnon par byed cing /
translated: He suppresses the afflictions.

original: bsgom pa des bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin par yang mi byed @116a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa des bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin par yang mi byed @116a * //
translated: He does not hold himself to be a meditator.

original: par dmigs pa la sems nye bar gtad de gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: par dmigs pa la sems nye bar gtad de gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed do //
translated: He strives to place the mind in meditative equipoise by directing the mind to the object.

original: de'i 'og tu gnas pa rab tu 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnas pa rab tu 'dzin par byed de /
translated: After that, he holds the mind in equipoise.

original: de rab tu bzung bas lus la ril por 'dzin pa gang gis kun nas dkris pa 'bring 'byung bar 'gyur ba de rnam par gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rab tu bzung bas lus la ril por 'dzin pa gang gis kun nas dkris pa 'bring 'byung bar 'gyur ba de rnam par gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: By holding it, he suppresses the afflictions that arise from the middling fetters by means of the gross grasping of the body as a whole.

original: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs te /
translated: Then, having abandoned the resistances to the supramundane dharmas,

original: gnyen po la gnas par 'gyur zhing de nyid brtan par byed do //
analyzed: gnyen po la gnas par 'gyur zhing de nyid brtan par byed do //
translated: he abides in the counteragents and stabilizes them.

original: de'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / chos la bdag med pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam par gnon par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / chos la bdag med pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam par gnon par byed do //
translated: Then, he conquers the delusion concerning dependent origination, the delusion concerning the selflessness of the person, and the delusion concerning the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de'i 'og tu lam ngan pa dang lam la nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lam ngan pa dang lam la nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, he turns away from the bad path and the path of doubt.

original: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa rags pa dang 'bring sel ba dang rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa rags pa dang 'bring sel ba dang rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, the knowledge which is the counteragent to the elimination and conquest of coarse and middling defilements is called mundane knowledge.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is supramundane knowledge?

original: de ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par mnan pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal phra mo'i gnyen por gyur pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par mnan pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal phra mo'i gnyen por gyur pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the knowledge that is the antidote to the subtle latent propensities of the afflictions that are suppressed by the afflictions that are thoroughly entangled with attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po de la gnas gsum la mkhas pa /
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po de la gnas gsum la mkhas pa /
translated: The antidote of suppression is based on three skills:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gang zag la bdag med par mos pa dang / chos la bdag med par mos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus pa las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir mi shes pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gang zag la bdag med par mos pa dang / chos la bdag med par mos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus pa las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir mi shes pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: skill in the dependent origination, interest in the selflessness of the person, and interest in the selflessness of phenomena. There are four types of ignorance that prevent one from completely transcending the afflictions.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa'i gnyen pos lung nod pa la mi ltos par so so'i bdag nyid kyi sems la so sor rtog cing 'bad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa'i gnyen pos lung nod pa la mi ltos par so so'i bdag nyid kyi sems la so sor rtog cing 'bad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the effort to discern the mind by oneself, without relying on the instruction of another, as the antidote to ignorance of the general characteristics of the mind, ignorance of the specific characteristics of the mind, ignorance of the characteristics of the defilement of the mind, and ignorance of the characteristics of the purification of the mind.

original: de la sems kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The general characteristics of the mind should be understood in three ways:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lkog na g-yo ba med pa nyid dang / de ltar gyi skad cig pa g-yo ba med pa nyid dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa rkyen las byung ba'i sems @116b kyis ma byas pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lkog na g-yo ba med pa nyid dang / de ltar gyi skad cig pa g-yo ba med pa nyid dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa rkyen las byung ba'i sems @116b kyis ma byas pa nyid kyis so //
translated: by its being dependent origination, by its being momentary, and by its being uncreated by a mind affected by passion, etc.

original: sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The specific characteristics of the mind should be understood in three ways:

original: snga ma bzhin du tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa dang / snga ma bzhin du rnam pa drug gis de bzhin nyid mi dmigs pa dang / 'phags pa thams cad kyi bye brag med pa'i shes pa mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du tha snyad las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa dang / snga ma bzhin du rnam pa drug gis de bzhin nyid mi dmigs pa dang / 'phags pa thams cad kyi bye brag med pa'i shes pa mi dmigs pas so //
translated: As before, it is non-apprehension through the nature of conventional designation, and as before, it is non-apprehension of thusness through the six aspects, and it is non-apprehension of the knowledge of the noble ones which is without distinction.

original: sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of the defilement of mind should also be understood through three aspects:

original: 'grub pa dang / 'jug pa dang / rgyu bas te /
analyzed: 'grub pa dang / 'jug pa dang / rgyu bas te /
translated: through establishment, through engagement, and through movement.

original: 'gro ba rnams su lus sna tshogs 'grub pa las ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su lus sna tshogs 'grub pa las ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'grub pa yin no //
translated: From the establishment of various bodies in the destinies, there is the establishment of defilement.

original: de ltar 'grub pa rang gi skad cig gi rgyun gyis 'jug pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad la gzung dka' bar 'jug pa dang / sred pa'i bag chags pas dbang bsgyur bas 'jug pa las ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'grub pa rang gi skad cig gi rgyun gyis 'jug pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad la gzung dka' bar 'jug pa dang / sred pa'i bag chags pas dbang bsgyur bas 'jug pa las ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa yin no //
translated: From the engagement of that establishment through the continuity of its own moments, from the engagement of all objective supports with difficulty, and from the engagement of the control of the latent tendencies of craving, there is the engagement of defilement.

original: gang du rgyu ba dang ji ltar rgyu ba las ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu ba yin te /
analyzed: gang du rgyu ba dang ji ltar rgyu ba las ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu ba yin te /
translated: The way it moves is the movement of affliction.

original: res 'ga' ni mi dge ba la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi dge ba la /
translated: Sometimes it moves toward the nonvirtuous,

original: res 'ga' ni dge ba la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni dge ba la /
translated: sometimes toward the virtuous,

original: res 'ga' ni yul la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni yul la /
translated: sometimes toward objects,

original: res 'ga' ni las mngon par 'du bya ba la'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni las mngon par 'du bya ba la'o //
translated: sometimes toward the performance of actions,

original: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa rnams la ste /
translated: and sometimes toward the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams la rgyu ba na yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nges par mi gnas pa de nyid 'dod chags dang bcas par gyur nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la rgyu ba na yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nges par mi gnas pa de nyid 'dod chags dang bcas par gyur nas /
translated: When it moves toward the afflictions, it does not definitely abide in attachment, aversion, and so on.ğŸ”½Having become attached, it becomes free from attachment,

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
translated: and having become free from attachment, it becomes attached.ğŸ”½It moves in a way that is not like that and so on.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas par 'gyur ba dang / de lta bu la sogs pa ma yin pa la rgyu ba dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams la dbang phyug thob cing rgyu ba dang / bdag nyid kyi bde ba spangs te sdug bsngal kun tu skyed par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas par 'gyur ba dang / de lta bu la sogs pa ma yin pa la rgyu ba dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams la dbang phyug thob cing rgyu ba dang / bdag nyid kyi bde ba spangs te sdug bsngal kun tu skyed par byed pa dang /
translated: It moves having attained mastery over phenomena that are like the basis of pleasure and so on, and it generates suffering having abandoned its own pleasure.

original: de yang mngon par zhen pa las ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang mngon par zhen pa las ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, they are not due to manifest clinging,

original: phyin ci log las yin pa dang de dag gis bdag nyid la sdug bsngal nye bar bsgrub pa dag gis rnam par mi ngoms par byed pa dang / dge ba rnams la nges par sbyar ba na de spang ba'i phyir skabs yongs su tshol bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: phyin ci log las yin pa dang de dag gis bdag nyid la sdug bsngal nye bar bsgrub pa dag gis rnam par mi ngoms par byed pa dang / dge ba rnams la nges par sbyar ba na de spang ba'i phyir skabs yongs su tshol bar byed pa dang /
translated: but due to error. They are insatiable due to the suffering they create for themselves. When they are definitely engaged in virtue, they seek opportunities to abandon it.ğŸ”½They seek faults in order to take up nonvirtue.

original: mi dge ba yang dag par blang ba'i phyir skyon yongs su tshol bar byed pa dang / 'byor ba dang / rgud pa dag la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dag gis bcom par 'gyur ba @117a * //
analyzed: mi dge ba yang dag par blang ba'i phyir skyon yongs su tshol bar byed pa dang / 'byor ba dang / rgud pa dag la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dag gis bcom par 'gyur ba @117a * //
translated: They are destroyed by attachment and anger toward prosperity and misfortune.ğŸ”½They fall under the power of carelessness and destroy all roots of virtue that have and have not been done.

original: dang ; bag med pa'i dbang du song zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba byas pa dang ma byas pa thams cad zad par byed pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dang ; bag med pa'i dbang du song zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba byas pa dang ma byas pa thams cad zad par byed pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir /
translated: They are attached to objects such as form.

original: gtan du phan pa 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings la so sor brtags shing so sor nyes par rnam par 'jog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gtan du phan pa 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings la so sor brtags shing so sor nyes par rnam par 'jog par byed pa ste /
translated: One examines and determines the realm of immortality, which is beneficial forever.

original: de ltar don de kun tu ston par byed pa nyon mongs pa can gyis bsdus pa'i dpe'i dngos po dag kyang rig par bya'o //
